GISAID

Source: vignettes/gisaid_flu_required_fields.Rmd
gisaid_flu_required_fields.Rmd

Overview

For all GISAID submissions, GISAID requires their users to batch uploading meta- and sequence- data to GISAID databases using their own Command Line Interface Tools (e.g. EpiCoV CLI, EpiFlu CLI, etc.) In this document, we are using GISAID EpiFlu CLI to batch uploading Influenza Virus A data.

Organism of interest

  • Influenza Virus A (FLU)

Required files to run EpiFlu CLI

  • Config file (a yaml format, e.g. config.yaml)
  • Fasta file (a fasta format, e.g. sequence.fasta)
  • Metadata worksheet (a csv format, e.g. metadata.csv)

Config file

Config file is a yaml file that provides a brief description about the submission and contains user credentials that would allow EpiFlu CLI to authenticate the database prior to upload a submission.

Fasta file

Fasta File contains nucleotide sequences for all samples.

Metatata worksheet

The metadata worksheet is a comma-delimited (csv) file that contains required attributes that are useful for the rapid analysis and trace back of Influenza Virus A cases.

Required Fields Description
Isolate_Id Must be empty String. The ID of the isolate will be provided by the GISAID-EPIFLUDB-System
Segment_Ids Must be empty String. The ID of the segment will be provided by the GISAID-EPIFLUDB-System
Isolate_Name E.g. “A/Brisbane/1444A/2010”
Subtype E.g. “H5N1”
Location E.g., “United Kingdom”, “Japan”, “China”, “United States”, etc.
Host Host or source name., E.g. “human”, “avian”, “chicken”, “Anas Acuta”, “environment”, etc.
Seq_Id (HA) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_HA”)
Seq_Id (NA) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_NA”)
Seq_Id (PB1) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_PB1”)
Seq_Id (PB2) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_PB2”)
Seq_Id (PA) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_PA”)
Seq_Id (MP) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_MP”)
Seq_Id (NS) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_NS”)
Seq_Id (NP) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_NP”)
Seq_Id (HE) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_HE”)
Seq_Id (P3) Name for the Segment (e.g. “A/test/Germany/testVIR8728/2023_P3”)
Originating_Lab_Id The numeric ID of the sample”s originating laboratory, e.g. “2698”
Collection_Date The date on which the sample was collected; must be in the ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD.
For example: 2020-03-25
